meanings.definition: The state or quality of being invisible.
meanings.sent1: The invisiblenesses of the ghost made it impossible to spot in the dark.
meanings.sent2: The cloak's invisiblenesses allowed the magician to disappear from sight.
meanings.sent3: The invisiblenesses of the ninja were so good that even the dog couldn't find him!
meanings.sent4: The invisiblenesses of the wind made its presence known only through the rustling leaves.
meanings.sent5: The invisiblenesses of the chameleon amazed the children as it blended perfectly with the leaves.

meanings.definition: The fact of being unseen or not able to be seen.
meanings.sent1: The invisiblenesses of the thief helped him escape without being noticed.
meanings.sent2: The invisiblenesses of the spy allowed her to gather information without being detected.
meanings.sent3: The invisiblenesses of the cat made it a master of sneaking up on unsuspecting birds.
meanings.sent4: The invisiblenesses of the night sky revealed the beauty of countless stars.
meanings.sent5: The invisiblenesses of the bacteria made it difficult to eradicate from the water supply.
